The birth of a genre. One of my all time favorite games.

I've just recently played the game, meaning this review is nostalgia-free.  Half way through the game, I can definitely say it's the best stealth game of all time and one of the best games ever.\n\nIf I could narrow it down to one reason, it would be the atmosphere.  The atmosphere created by the sound, setting, and visuals, all coupled with the tension from knowing at any minute someone might spot and kill you, is unmatched even today for a game like this.  There's a real challenge in Thief, especially if you want to play non-lethal.  There's multiple routes through each level, and there's no hand-holding, giving the player great freedom of choice, but also making it easy to get lost or stuck.  That's really the only negative I can think of.
amazing classic game very hard 10/10

They don't make games like this anymore. I bought this game because it is a classic in the same way as System Shock 2 and Deus Ex. Two games I also like. Yes, this game is old. I had to find a mod on google to play the game in widescreen. Character models are hilariously lumpy. Textures look grainy if you get too close to them. If you insist on having state-of-the-art graphics (that your computer can't even fully run) in your games, then you will hate Thief Gold.

However, if you can tolerate the graphics, you will find that they actually enhance the feel of the game. It's a unique feeling to see a new kind of enemy and still have no idea what it is after its killed you more than five times. The shadows and lighting are primitive, but if you are playing a stealth game and need you hide in the shadows, you should be glad that the shadows are so dark and clean-cut.

Gameplay is very fine. No other game encourages stealth by giving you a combat tutorial that shows how broken the combat actually is. If you were like me, you'll play the first few missions way too aggressively and end up being chased by soldiers everywhere the whole time. As the game gets harder though, and you stand even a smaller chance against each enemy, you'll be able to use the sneaking mechanics the right way.

What you will be able to quickly recognize in the game is how much it doesn't explain. Just google what each type of arrow does and you'll thank me. The only other things that could be frustrating are the mission objectives. If you've played Goldeneye 007 you should understand. Some objectives are so vague that you must just explore the whole level until something happens.

Exploring levels is very enjoyable though. Each level is different in setting and theme. There are mansions, caverns, streets, tombs, towers, etc. Level design seems very simple at first, but the later levels get more complex, I think at times rivaling the GoldSource Engine in complexity.

Most levels are either sneaking past guards and getting loot, or exploring monster-infested caves for plot items. Both are enjoyable. The sneaking ones are generally more involved but more frustrating. I think there is a nice balance.

Overall, the game is surprisingly enjoyable. If you can appreciate older games, give it a go. If you are worried that it won't hold up as good as you remember when you last played it ten years ago, give it a go.

The game is not the greatest compared to everything else out there, but its high status is deserved as Thief Gold is a gem of FPS history that went on to inspire every other FPS after it.

Amazing game, even though it's over 15 years old at this point it still manages to give an intense experience with great ambience, intiuitive and logical controls, and incredible characterization. Though dated, in my opinion this game has stood the test of time and I recommend it to any fan of stealth games. After all it's one of the games responsible for creating the stealth genre in the first place.

Even though this game is old its gold like it name says. Most missions are good and areas are different and sometimes even maze like. You will play as Garrett (master thief) who will get in areas where thiefs arent very appreciated, so stealth and shadows are his best friends along with some special equipments that he owns. Combat is quite clunky and Garrett isnt exactly your swordsman but he got bow which helps alot in challenges that will come. Took 20 hours for me to complete this so it has good hours for single player game from my view. Because of difficulty settings you will get more hours in this game to spent.

PRIMARY NOTE IF YOU BUY: Since this is an old game and the steam version, it does not play cutscenes. They are there, but for some reason, the steam version doesn't want to play them. Google T.Fix or look for it in the guides for this game and that will solve the problem. It's not too hard to download and use.

I didn't like this game at first. I just wandered the streets of the first level and I tried to fight the guards. Then I quit because I was frustrated that I had to start over and I didn't know where to go or that I should save often.

Then I gave it a second chance and remembered it's a stealth game. Customizing the controls helps a lot. This is one of my favorite games now. I actually like the sequel a little better, but this game is still good. It's old and you can count the polygons on just about anything you see in this game, but the story and gameplay are good or at least interesting.

I was chased by guards in a casino. I stopped to spin the roulette things, ran, and I killed myself with a mine I planted.

I tormented a guard by jumping from a ledge to a ladder, making him climb stairs...then I threw a bag of flour (or something) at him and he died.

I knocked out a guard and threw him down a well and killed him. Later I knocked out a different guard and threw him down stairs for fun because the bodies slide funny. I think he survived, but I didn't check. It doesn't seem to matter if kill the guards after you knock them out. I still need to try to kill a guard with the body of another guard.

I was at a point where I hid from everything. I'm now at a point where I will rotate saves and knock out everyone or fight everything...unless it's undead or the final boss, then ♥♥♥♥ that. Especially the zombies and Haunts and you're out of holywater or fire based weapons.

Also this game made me hate monkeys.

The only bad thing I can say about this game is the cutscene thing and that the maps are a little confusing at first so you can get lost if you've never played it. If you don't save or die, it'll restart the whole level unless you can load a save. Also steam will not save your save files if the game is uninstalled or if something happens to your save files. I've had to replay this and the sequel at least twice. I didn't really mind though. It's better than the remake...and cheaper.

also you can kill people with flour bags. Come on.
Awseome game to get stoned to and search for treasure and ♥♥♥♥.  Mad classic

I can say nothing bad about this game.  Dated graphics?  Pshaw, play the game and it doesn't matter.\n\nThis is what medieval Hitman would be like, if going in guns blazing was suicide - open ended from every angle.  As someone who played this when it first came out, there are play styles which are not rewarded in-game, but are infinitely satisfying: steal all the loot, use nothing which could be found later (water arrows, noise arrows, etc) and knock no one out.  The aftermath is that everything valuable is gone from the house, there are no clues, and no guard saw anything...do this and you aren't a thief - you're a shadow!

Introduction:
Thief Gold is a first-person stealth game set in a medieval/fantasy world in which you play as Garrett, a master thief who makes his living by stealing from the rich.  And in order to avoid any spoilers... well, let's just say things get complicated.

This is the first game in the Thief series and the extended edition of Thief: The Dark Project.  It includes all of the original game content and features three new missions adapted to the original storyline along with full voice acting and new graphics.

TLDR Highlights:
+++ Stealth Gameplay and Utilities
++ Voice Acting
+ Improved (but still old) Graphics

-- Slow Start/Story
- Wonky Hit-boxes

= No wonder it's such a beloved classic!  The old graphics might turn some people off, but if you can get past it, then I highly recommend playing this one.

Review:
PROS -- The main feature of this game is also the very best thing about it:  stealth gameplay.  I also believe this game is the first to use first-person 3D stealth, which is honestly pretty amazing considering how good it is!  Near the beginning of the game, I was trying to hide in the shadows but it wasn't dark enough thanks to some torches.  Now, this is my very first time ever playing this game, so at first I just made do, thinking this game was far too old to have useful mechanics like removing the torches or, better yet, putting them out somehow.  Sure enough, I found water arrows in my inventory and was able to shoot them at torches to put them out and create more shadows!  There's also rope arrows, noisemaker arrows, moss arrows (to create a quieter surface to walk on), not to mention a blackjack and the need for multiple kinds of lockpicks that somehow made me feel like I was actually picking locks even though the mechanic is extremely simple.  All of this and more are what make the game fun.  Master them, and you'll look be running around like a Master Thief in no time!!

Since I never played the original version of this game, I can't compare how the voice acting now compares to how things were then, but I can say that I'm very impressed with it in Thief Gold.  It honestly surprised me right from the start how good it was.  Even the idle chit chat of the variou NPCs were rather good (and often funny lol).

As for the graphics, I did end up seeing some images of the old graphics and they have been noticeably improved.  I also recommend using TGTool, which is what I used for some additional improvements, such as 1080 resolution and darker shadows/ambient lighting, making the game even more immersive.

CONS -- My biggest and main gripe about the game, however, is the slow start.  This is most likely caused by the pacing of the story.  Some of the first missions were cool and all, but I didn't really feel a sense of purpose.  Sure, there would be little cutscenes that gave me an explanation as to why I was going to this place and stealing that item, but it was lacking in the big picture" department.  In fact

reviewText: Classic and amazing stealth game.

First of all the stealth mechanics are excellent. The game is easy to understand but hard to complete. Yes, you have a map, but in the map you don't know where are you any you need to use your instinct. The IA is good and you never will make it easy if you've never played the thief.
There are several weapons and many kinds of arrow for each occasion. For example the sword (only be used if you chase), the Blackjack (that you will use to knock out the enemies) and different types of arrows for any occasion such as an arrow with a rope to climb, the arrow water to extinguish torches, the arrow with sleeping gas to stop the enemy  etc.

This game is a 9.5/10 in my opinion. Is just perfect but the game but the game does not have any checkpoint so if you die you'll have to start over from the beginning of the level and you'll have to save the game manually or by pressing F11.

An extremely difficult game when played on hard or higher... A difficult game is a good one, and this game has never failed to dissapoint. My first memories of my gaming era began with this game, right here. The way the sounds you make and the sorounding lighting instantly make you forget everything you know about gaming, and make you learn a completely new style of what we call video games. Can't wait for Thief on PS4, and can only hope it's half as good as this one... But maybe with some better graphics.  ;)

reviewText: can escape guards by climbing on tables\n\n10/10

I can say nothing bad about this game.  Dated graphics?  Pshaw, play the game and it doesn't matter.\n\nThis is what medieval Hitman would be like, if going in guns blazing was suicide - open ended from every angle.  As someone who played this when it first came out, there are play styles which are not rewarded in-game, but are infinitely satisfying: steal all the loot, use nothing which could be found later (water arrows, noise arrows, etc) and knock no one out.  The aftermath is that everything valuable is gone from the house, there are no clues, and no guard saw anything...do this and you aren't a thief - you're a shadow!
My most favourite game of all time. Classic! Lost count of how many times I've passed and re-played the whole Thief series over and over again.
Idk I got it Free

It is amazing to see how such a well crafted game still holds up to our modern gaming society through the amazingly constructed environment with smart and big level maps.  I personally found the game quite long.  Each level is just as the other (These levels can be massive!!!), walk into a building/area, each unique to one another, just to find that there a multiple ways to complete most of the quests.  For example, steal a key from a guard, open the front doors, overhear a guard talk about a back entrance, or find a hidden passage which you heard from a diary within this environment.  The possibilities are endless!!! I highly recemend this game also because it is such a revolutionary title.  This game is the first game to apply lighting and sound to the stealth franchise.  Great consept even though the story may be lacking and the dialog sound terrible. The combat is perposefully bad since this game highly supports the idea of stealth and making sure npcs do not even realize your are there.  I personally highly recemend this game to anyone who loves playing classic games, who loves taking their time and thinking things through, who just wants to play a revolutionary game, and wouldn't mind to get their butt kicked in the process through this games purposeful difficulty.
Great game, worth buying no matter what price
Old but Gold

Thief is a game like system shock but harder and more challenging its also a very creepy game you fight mad knights, zombies and other medievel shiiiiiet. This game is no walk in the park its like a  walk in the park at night while being chased by pedo bear and jimmy savile its tense and scary. Use water arrows to get rid of light sources (the dark is your friend) and use your club to knock out unsuspecting victims. You must plan your move to achieve your goal. I reccomend.

This game is amazing despite it being old. I never played it before, so I was not going into some nostaligia-trip. At first, since the game was so old, I did not enjoy any of it, until I did the first three missions and I started to get the hang of it. The story is great, the gameplay is fantastic, your inventory of tools is wonderful. On top of it, this game is huge. I never been overwhelmed by a game of such size. There is no map to hold you hand, it is all up to you to figure it out, and the vast size of each map is overwhelming at first. This game is extremely long. It took me 37 hours to beat it, but I played the at the highest difficulty setting. So it will last you a while. Get yourself the Gold" version
recommended: the expansion adds to the value of the game. The only weakness of this game is the AI is really stupid
hoursPlayed: but it does not end up ruining the game for you. I rate this game at 9.5 / 10."

reviewText:
A fantastic first person action stealth game.  Hide in the shadows, silent in your approach. Sneak and steal your way through many a unique areas with multiple paths, hidden treasures, and objectives that get better and better as you play. If you like stealth, thievery, archery, swordplay, big open levels, lockpicking, and good classic PC games this is worth a go.

I'd recommend the GoG version instead Steam's otherwise you'll need to find a patch or mod to get the cutscenes and other things to work properly. Which you should want as the cutscenes are pretty badass for a sixteen or more years old game. Gog's version is either completly or more up to date than Steam's and you don't need to hassle yourself figuring out how to update it yourself. Also the controls are pretty hard to get used for someone who never played this when it was first released. I'd also recommend remapping the controls to something you may be more used. I use ASDW for moving, Shift for fast walk, C for crouch, Z for lean forward, Control for speed toggle, space for jump, and keep the rest the same.

Don't let my hours fool you. The majority of my time spent on this game was on GOG.

This is a great stealth game of hiding killing knocking out, to you just dying. The only difficult is the brightness factor so if you play on a laptop I reccomend plugging it in to your tv so you can see better. 10/10 The first thief here on steam has three more missions added then it had on the game disc.

Question... I just downloaded thief gold and it works fine except the cut scenes between the levels dont play. I love this game but the story line is the best part and im just wondering if anyone knows how to get them playing again??

I immediately loved this game from the first time I played it 18 years ago on a free trial disk. It has the best replay value of almost any game I've ever played, and I've played through it at least 10 times before it was available on Steam. With the new HD mod that Bentraxx developed (and continues to polish), I have begun to play through it yet again and it is incredible. This game is in my top 3, and I doubt I will ever cease to enjoy its incredibly immersive atmosphere. A couple tips for those who haven't tried it: 1. Play in a dark room, and 2. Make sure you have plenty of free time, as you will be engaged for a while.

This is a classic title that everyone who considers themselves a gamer simply must play. The storytelling is excellent, the character development is great, and the game play is unforgettable. Buy this, and you will not regret it.

A note for those playing on Win7x64: you will need to install a patch to fix the game so that videos and other things work correctly on Windows 7 or higher.
